criteria: Knowledge of HIV/STD Testing and Medical Care
descriptions: One local resource is identified, but it lacks specific details or contains inaccuracies.
Two local resources are identified, but details may be incomplete or have minor inaccuracies.
Three local resources are identified with generally accurate details.
Four local resources are accurately identified with specific details, demonstrating a good understanding.
Five or more local resources are accurately identified with comprehensive details, demonstrating excellent knowledge and understanding.
Information on FDA-approved contraceptives is missing or entirely inaccurate.
Limited and partially inaccurate information is provided on one or two FDA-approved contraceptives.
Information is provided on a few FDA-approved contraceptives, but there are some inaccuracies or omissions.
Accurate information is provided on several FDA-approved contraceptives.
Comprehensive and accurate information is provided on a wide range of FDA-approved contraceptives, demonstrating thorough understanding.
Provides exceptional detail on a comprehensive range of FDA-approved contraceptives, including their mechanisms, effectiveness, and proper usage, demonstrating mastery of the topic.
No mention or understanding of HIV/STD testing or related medical care.
Basic mention of HIV/STD testing or medical care, but lacks detail or contains inaccuracies.
Identifies HIV/STD testing and medical care resources with some accurate details.
Provides accurate information about HIV/STD testing procedures and available medical care.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of HIV/STD testing, treatment options, and relevant medical care resources.
Exhibits comprehensive knowledge of HIV/STD testing, treatment, prevention strategies, and related medical care, demonstrating expertise in the area.
